BR_text.BRdescription:
Using str(token) should return the equivalent of token.orth_.encode('utf8') . However when I use it I get back the equivalent of token.text_with_ws . My work around is unicode(token.orth_) .
 Thanks for a great package !

comments_0.comment_text:
Thanks, fixed.
 This sort of fix is nasty because it involves a change in semantics that might silently break existing code. To help people ease the transition, I've added a toggle spacy.tokens.token.keep_Token__str__semantics. Passing True to this function sets a global switch that preserves the old semantics.
 This function will disappear in a future version --- it's just there to help people migrate their code.

comments_2.comment_text: This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
